data.title: The best salad on the world
data.text: They have the best chicken salad and there ranch is very good they have very good food I live right by here so I always eat here

data.title: Great burgers but no atmosphere
data.text: This place was across the street from my office so I decided to give it a try. The place looks like it has the original furniture from the 60's but they had a big selection so I gave them a try. The prices are great and the selection is huge but I decided on the double cheeseburger combo - wow! The burger was cooked over an open flame and had a unique sauce on it which was outstanding. The fries were hot and plentiful and my entire lunch was around $7.00.  Great little Hole In The Wall!!

data.title: Disgusting place with horrible good service!
data.text: One time I found a piece of wood in my taco! 2 times I found pieces of plastic wrap in my tacos! Most of the time the tacos tasted so old and the shells are mostly always stale! The ground beef tacos taste like they've been re cooked or just microwaved to defrost and then fried again... And the chicken they use for their chicken tacos has this horrible smell! The French fries are good but only when they decide to change their old gross oil they usually fry it in! The workers here are rude and annoying! This place needs a new owner and all dirty employees fired! The I will consider changing my rating lol I would recommend going to in and out 2 exits away off Fredrick or 5 guys burgers!

data.title: You might as well walk on down to McDonalds down the street.
data.text:
I am completely baffled as to how this place has a grade A rating. Seriously, who did you pay off to get a rating like that? Now normally, I don't bother writing poor reviews for places I don't like (it's kind of a waste of time for me).  BUT think I can make an accept ion for Perris Burger. Now, I've been to Perris burger a total of 4 times -only two of which I used the drive thru instead of going inside- and my past few visits were so-so. But this visit in particular just sealed the deal on my view of this place. 
Problem #1: NONE of the cooks wear gloves or hairnets. That's a big problem for me. Why? I've had experiences where I used a restaurant restroom and seen an employee use the bathroom and head straight back out to the kitchen, without even taking a glance at the sink. Just because you put up a sign saying, "All employees must wash hands," doesn't mean that every employees is going to obey that policy. And as for the hairnets thing..Hello, hair sheds, and can easily fall into your food. 
Problem #2: The place itself is nasty. The napkin dispenser looked like it hadn't been wiped down in weeks, the chairs had all kinds of stains on them, and the windows were so dirty you could barely see out of them. *Tip: You might want to order a cup of hot water to sterilize your silverware in before you use it...just saying..
Problem #3: Quality of food not worth the price they charge. I had ordered a large plate of carne Asada fries (cost me like $6.50) and it took almost 15 minutes for me to get my food. My whole table got their food in order, then even the people who came in and ordered way after me got their food. Finally, when my table is more than halfway done with their food, I decide to go and check on my order, thinking that they may have forgotten about me. I asked where my fries were and the employees looked around puzzled like they had no clue where my food was at. Then someone says "Oh yeah go get the fries out of the microwave." Why were my fries sitting in the microwave for like 15 minutes??? Really? Sit down to dig in to my food because I'm starving and thoroughly pissed and my food doesn't even look that great. Most of my fries were either burnt or got soggy. I didn't get any guacamole or sour cream either. For the price I paid and the time I had to wait! I probably could've just gone to Alberto's to get better quality food. 

Overall, if for whatever reason you decide to stroll through Moreno Valley on a trip, do not waste your gas and money on Perris Burger. There's plenty of better quality/priced fast food joints less than 5 minutes away.

data.title: What a dump!
data.text: Walked over from our hotel. My wife had the two fish taco special and I wanted  the pastrami but they had run out so I opted for the steak sandwich combo. After a twenty minute wait I was handed our meals. The fish tacos were made with over fried fish sticks (one in each taco) lettuce and a few cubes of tomato. They were awful. My steak sandwich was a charred peace of fatty  gristle and overcooked, dry meat, tomato and bits of tough lettuce on a dry peace of hoagie roll. The sandwich was so dry I gave up eating it after working through part of the first half. My wife said it all as we left this culinary void, "I'm glad that's over." We both were.

data.title: Moreno valley
data.text: This place has great food and the people are very nice and very close to where we are staying . it walking close
